title: Travel Information
text:
STAYING IN  SANTA MARTA








The wedding party will be staying at the Hilton Santa Marta in Pozos Colorados. We are finalizing the details for a group rate and will provide more details soon. Guests are welcomed to start booking your travel if you prefer getting ahead.


Hilton Santa Marta

Carrera 2 #114-78,  Pozos Colorados, Santa Marta  Magdalena, Colombia +57 605 435 1770



For anyone interested in other hotel or AirBnB options, we recommend staying in the Pozos Colorados area due to its central location and the convenience of staying close to the wedding party. Below are some additional hotel options–













Hotel Mercure
Calle 115 NO 2 39 Bello Horizonte
Tel. 035 4368484

Cra. 2 #6-80, Bello Horizonte
Tel. 035 4380011

title: Our Story
text:
SO WE MET IN CHEMISTRY.










We were lab partners at our high school chemistry class and quickly became friends. After graduation, we kept in touch even when Juan moved to New York in 2011. The signs were always there, like that New Year’s sunrise in South Beach or that night in the party bus rolling through the streets of Manhattan.  It wasn’t until Andrea moved to New York that our romantic story unfolded. Twenty years since we met, it still feels like we’re those two kids in chemistry.
Now, just in love and ready for our next chapter.












 
Our Story  Travel FAQ RSVP

Contact:
If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us!
Email: andreasonlyjuan@gmail.com  Event planner, Karol: +57 123-456-7890

title: Our Story
text:
We were lab partners in our high school chemistry class and quickly became friends. We admired each other from a distance once we graduated and grew as young adults.
Our mutual friends and social media kept us in touch. The signs were always there but it wasn’t until Andrea moved to New York in 2019 that our romantic story unfolded.
Twenty years later, it still feels like we’re those two kids in chemistry. Now just in love and ready for our forever.
…ready to officially be husband and wife. …ready to officially be Mr. and Mrs.

title: Travel Information
text:
For Colombian Ministry of Foreign Affairs Visas: Visas Information
Check if you need a visa: List of Countries
If you have a passport issued by the States or territories on List A , B or C , or those listed as Special Visa Exemption Cases, you may enter, stay in and leave Colombia, without a visa, for short-stay activities (including business, leisure, tourism or cultural interest), as long as these activities do not generate payments for services, salary or wages in Colombia. (Resolution 5488 of June 22, 2022 and Resolution 3717 of May 23, 2023).

Nos llena el corazón saber que se unirán a la celebración y nos acompañarán en este momento tan especial.  If possible, we would recommend looking into flying in Thursday and flying out Sunday (at the earliest).
We’d also encourage staying past Sunday at your leisure so you can explore everything this beautiful region has to offer.
Check out our FAQs for more insight into traveling in Santa Marta and Colombia in general.

title: A&J FAW
text:
FAQ

 

What is the dress code for the wedding?
The dress code is beach formal. Consider light, airy fabrics suitable for warm, tropical climate and a celebration by the beach.



What days should I fly in and out for the celebration?
Our big day will be on Friday, December 5th, and an optional event on Thursday, so we recommend guests fly in at minimum Wednesday, December 3rd.  We will have an optional event on Saturday, so it would be ideal for guests to stay at least until Sunday, December 7th.



What is the itinerary for the weekend?
We are coordinating all the details for the weekend and will have final details soon. To help get your planning started, please know we will be hosting a welcome event the evening of December 4th, followed by our wedding the next day and an optional post wedding event on Saturday.



What airport should I fly into? Are there other options?
Santa Marta’s international airport is Simón Bolívar International Airport (SMR).
There aren’t any direct flights from the US, but there are one stop flights departing from the Miami/Ft. Lauderdale or New York area.
Alternatively, guests can fly directly to Barranquilla and take a two hour shuttle from Ernesto Cortissoz International Airport (BAQ) to Santa Marta (SMR). The public shuttle can be around $8-$15 USD per person.



How do I get from the airport to the hotel?
Uber and local taxis are accessible in Santa Marta, but we are still coordinating the details around general transport so will provide an update soon.



Is Santa Marta generally safe?
Yes! Like any destination, we recommend standard precautions – but Santa Marta is a lovely coastal town known for its relaxed vibe, friendly locals, and beautiful landscapes.
As long as you stay aware of your surroundings, you’ll be able to enjoy all the beauty the city has to offer.



Do I need a visa to visit Colombia? Any passport requirements?
Most visitors from the U.S., Canada, and the EU don’t need a visa—just a valid passport. Please ensure your passport is not set to expire less than six months post December 2025.



Is Uber available in Santa Marta?
Yes, uber is available in Santa Marta.



What areas of town should we look into?
The wedding party will be staying in the Bello Horizonte area. It is a quieter beachfront area with beautiful views, plenty of hotel options, and a more peaceful vibe. It is also ~10-15 minutes away from the airport.  Other areas - Centro Histórico neighborhood (~30 minutes from the airport). It’s busier and farther from the beach, but walkable.
El Rodadero is another popular area (~25 minutes from the airport). It is lively and full of restaurants and nightlife although it can be very touristy.
You really can’t go wrong in Santa Marta, it all depends on what you’re looking for.



Where is the wedding party staying? Will there be a room block or group code?
The wedding party will be staying at the Hilton in Santa Marta’s Bello Horizonte area. We will follow-up with more details around a potential room block or group rate soon.



What are some fun things to do in Santa Marta?
Excursions -
Tayrona National Natural Park - one of Colombia’s most breathtaking national parks with lucious, tropical hikes and stunning beaches
Minca - a tiny town tucked into the Sierra Nevada mountains. Visit eco-lodges, tour coffee farms, and swim in the Pozo Azul waterfall
Taganga - bohemian and budget friendly side of town that offers scuba diving and snorkeling excursions



What’s the weather like in December?
December in Santa Marta is one of the best times to visit - warm and sunny! Daytime highs range between 85–90°F (29–32°C) with nighttime lows between 73–77°F (23–25°C).
Keep in mind that Santa Marta is in the Caribbean coast so you can’t escape the humidity but December is generally less humid than other months.
Make sure to bring your sunscreen and light layers for ocean breezes at night!



What is the local currency in Colombia?
The local currency in Colombia is the Colombian Peso (COP). Credit/debit cards are widely accepted and ATMs are available around town. Cash is useful for taxi, tips, markets, and street vendors.




 
Our Story  Travel FAQ RSVP

title: A&J FAW
section: What is the dress code for the wedding?
text:
What is the dress code for the wedding?
The dress code is beach formal. Consider light, airy fabrics suitable for warm, tropical climate and a celebration by the beach. For the ladies, consider platform heels (no stilettos).

title: A&J FAW
section: What days should I fly in and out for the celebration?
text:
What days should I fly in and out for the celebration?
Our big day will be on Friday, December 5th, and an optional event on Thursday, so we recommend guests fly in at minimum Wednesday, December 3rd.  We will have an optional event on Saturday, so it would be ideal for guests to stay at least until Sunday, December 7th.

title: A&J FAW
section: What is the itinerary for the weekend?
text:
What is the itinerary for the weekend?
There will be wedding events Thursday-Saturday. Our big day will be on Friday, December 5th. There are optional events Thursday evening (welcome cocktails) and Saturday afternoon (beach club). We are coordinating the final details for the weekend and will have more to share soon.

title: A&J FAW
section: What airport should I fly into? Are there other options?
text:
What airport should I fly into? Are there other options?
Santa Marta’s international airport is Simón Bolívar International Airport (SMR).
There aren’t any direct flights from the US, but there are one stop flights departing from the Miami/Ft. Lauderdale or New York area.
Alternatively, guests can fly directly to Barranquilla and take a two hour shuttle from Ernesto Cortissoz International Airport (BAQ) to Santa Marta (SMR). The public shuttle can be around $8-$15 USD per person.

title: A&J FAW
section: How do I get from the airport to the hotel?
text:
How do I get from the airport to the hotel?
Uber and local taxis are accessible in Santa Marta, but we are still coordinating the details around general transport so will provide an update soon.

title: A&J FAW
text:
Is Santa Marta generally safe?
Yes! Like any foreign destination, we recommend standard precautions – but Santa Marta is a lovely coastal town known for its relaxed vibe, friendly locals, and beautiful landscapes. As long as you stay aware of your surroundings, you’ll be able to enjoy all the beauty the city has to offer.

title: A&J FAW
section: Do I need a visa to visit Colombia? Any passport requirements?
text:
Do I need a visa to visit Colombia? Any passport requirements?
Most visitors from the U.S., Canada, and the EU don’t need a visa—just a valid passport. Please ensure your passport is not set to expire less than six months post December 2025.

title: A&J FAW
section: Is Uber available in Santa Marta?
text:
Is Uber available in Santa Marta?
Yes, uber is easily accessible in Santa Marta.

title: A&J FAW
section: What areas of town should we look into?
text:
What areas of town should we look into?
The wedding party will be staying in Pozos Colorado. It is a quieter beachfront area with beautiful views, plenty of hotel options, and a more peaceful vibe. It is also ~10-15 minutes away from the airport, the wedding vanue, and downtown Santa Marta. Other options –

Centro Histórico (~30 minutes from the airport). It’s busier and farther from the beach, but walkable.

El Rodadero (~25 minutes from the airport) is lively and full of restaurants and nightlife although it can be very touristy.

title: A&J FAW
section: Where is the wedding party staying? Will there be a room block or group code?
text:
Where is the wedding party staying? Will there be a room block or group code?
The wedding party will be staying at the Hilton in Santa Marta’s Bello Horizonte area. We will follow-up with more details around a potential room block or group rate soon.

title: A&J FAW
section: What are some fun things to do in Santa Marta?
text:
What are some fun things to do in Santa Marta?
– Excursions –

Tayrona National Natural Park - one of Colombia’s most breathtaking national parks with lucious, tropical hikes and stunning beaches.

Minca - a tiny town tucked into the Sierra Nevada mountains. Visit eco-lodges, tour coffee farms, and swim in the Pozo Azul waterfall.

Taganga - bohemian and budget friendly side of town that offers scuba diving and snorkeling excursions.

– Restaurants –

Lulo Café Bar de Jugos, Altamar Café, Donde Chucho, Batey, Ouzu, Santa Mesa, BK Restaurante

– Things to see –

El Pibe Valderrama statue outside the Estadio Eduardo Santos.

Quinta de San Pedro Alejandrino – Hacienda where Simón Bolivar spent his last days.

Tairona Gold Museum.

title: A&J FAW
section: What’s the weather like in December?
text:
What’s the weather like in December?
Daytime highs range between 85–90°F (29–32°C) with nighttime lows between 73–77°F (23–25°C) with humidity throughout the day. Make sure to bring your sunscreen and light layers for ocean breezes at night!

title: A&J FAW
section: What is the local currency in Colombia?
text:
What is the local currency in Colombia?
The local currency in Colombia is the Colombian Peso (COP). Credit/debit cards are widely accepted and ATMs are available around town. Cash is useful for taxi, tips, markets, and street vendors.

title: A&J FAW
section: What days should I fly in for the celebration?
text:
What days should I fly in for the celebration?
Guests are encouraged to arrive Wednesday or Thursday afternoon to be part of all of the events.

title: A&J FAW
section: What is the itinerary for the weekend?
text:
What is the itinerary for the weekend?
We are coordinating all the details for the weekend and will have final details soon. To help get your planning started, please know we will be hosting a welcome event the evening of December 4th, followed by our wedding the next day and an optional post wedding event on Saturday.

title: A&J FAW
section: What airport should I fly into?
text:
What airport should I fly into?
Santa Marta’s international airport is Simón Bolívar International Airport (SMR). There aren’t any direct flights from the US, but there are one stop flights from the Miami/Ft. Lauderdale and the New York area with reasonably short layovers in Bogota or Panama. Simón Bolívar International Airport (SMR) is 10 minutes from the Pozos Colorados district (where the wedding party will be staying in). Uber and local taxis are easily accessible from the airport.

title: A&J FAW
section: Where is the wedding party staying? Will there be a room block or group rate?
text:
Where is the wedding party staying? Will there be a room block or group rate?
The wedding party will be staying at the Hilton in Pozos Colorados, Santa Marta (see travel tab on our site). We will follow-up with more details on the group rate soon.

title: A&J FAW
section: Will the ceremony reception be indoors or outdoors?
text:
Will the ceremony reception be indoors or outdoors?
The ceremony and reception will be held outdoors.
